definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: One of the disadvantages of the phenothiazines is their potential for dystonic effects.
sentences.chinese: 吩噻嗪类药物弊端在于其潜在的张力不能反应。

sentences.english: And then there is China, which has the greatest potential to undermine the Asia-Pacific peace.
sentences.chinese: 还有就是中国，他是本地区巨大的潜在力量。

sentences.english: This policy brief is an attempt to put concerns relating to potential allergenicity into perspective.
sentences.chinese: 本篇政策摘要将透视对潜在过敏性的担忧。

sentences.english: The results supported the potential for using triage-based PDA systems at mass gatherings .
sentences.chinese: 评估结果显示本系统在支援大型活动的潜在价值。

sentences.english: In fact, reporters had been warned beforehand about the potentially over-aggressive conduct.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，记者们在之前被警告过潜在的侵犯行为。

sentences.english: ''Our research shows one potential reason why swearing developed and why it persists.
sentences.chinese: 我们的研究给出了咒骂存在并发展的一个潜在原因。

sentences.english: Human lysozyme has potential use value on clinic.
sentences.chinese: 人溶菌酶在临床上具有潜在的使用价值。

sentences.english: We have a right to know if a potential partner has herpes.
sentences.chinese: 我们有权知道潜在的伴侣是否患有疱疹。

sentences.english: Ssangyong says it is in the initial stages of talks with potential strategic investors.
sentences.chinese: 双龙称，正与潜在战略投资者进行初期谈判。

sentences.english: Of course, exercise and vitamin supplements can't head off all potential risks.
sentences.chinese: 当然，锻炼和维生素补充剂不能抵御所有的潜在风险。

sentences.english: Reviews of experience point to potential benefits and practical difficulties of such systems.
sentences.chinese: 回顾指向潜在利益与在这样的系统中实际困难的经验。

sentences.english: They warn us of dangerous trends. They point out potent evils.
sentences.chinese: 他们为我们警告对危险倾向，指出潜在的邪恶。

sentences.english: A potential solution, so we know at least the problem is solvable.
sentences.chinese: 潜在的解决方案，因此我们至少知道问题是可解决的。

sentences.english: The potential curricula is a new task and hotspot of the current teaching research?
sentences.chinese: 潜在课程是当今教学研究的一个新课题和热点。

sentences.english: And the research is further evidence that pesticides are a potential cause.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究近一步显示刹虫剂是潜在影响因素。

sentences.english: This translates into  potentially thousands of dollars that you saved the employer.
sentences.chinese: 这就会转化为你潜在的为老板节省了上千美元。

definition: to profit from sth/to get benefit
to make clear/to make known/to state clearly/to indicate/known
to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
in case (sth happens)/if/once (sth happens, then...)/when/in a short time/in one day
